lines.text: Enter EDMUND, and CURAN meets him

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Save thee, Curan.

lines.speaker: curan
lines.text: And you, sir. I have been with your father, and given him notice that the Duke of Cornwall and Regan his duchess will be here with him this night.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: How comes that?

lines.speaker: curan
lines.text: Nay, I know not. You have heard of the news abroad; I mean the whispered ones, for they are yet but ear-kissing arguments?

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Not I pray you, what are they?

lines.speaker: curan
lines.text: Have you heard of no likely wars toward, 'twixt the Dukes of Cornwall and Albany?

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Not a word.

lines.speaker: curan
lines.text: You may do, then, in time. Fare you well, sir.
Exit

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: The duke be here to-night? The better! best! This weaves itself perforce into my business. My father hath set guard to take my brother; And I have one thing, of a queasy question, Which I must act: briefness and fortune, work! Brother, a word; descend: brother, I say! My father watches: O sir, fly this place; Intelligence is given where you are hid; You have now the good advantage of the night: Have you not spoken 'gainst the Duke of Cornwall? He's coming hither: now, i' the night, i' the haste, And Regan with him: have you nothing said Upon his party 'gainst the Duke of Albany? Advise yourself.
Enter EDGAR

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: I am sure on't, not a word.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: I hear my father coming: pardon me: In cunning I must draw my sword upon you Draw; seem to defend yourself; now quit you well. Yield: come before my father. Light, ho, here! Fly, brother. Torches, torches! So, farewell. Some blood drawn on me would beget opinion. Of my more fierce endeavour: I have seen drunkards Do more than this in sport. Father, father! Stop, stop! No help?
Exit EDGAR
Wounds his arm
Enter GLOUCESTER, and Servants with torches

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Now, Edmund, where's the villain?

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Here stood he in the dark, his sharp sword out, Mumbling of wicked charms, conjuring the moon To stand auspicious mistress,--

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: But where is he?

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Look, sir, I bleed.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Where is the villain, Edmund?

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Fled this way, sir. When by no means he could--

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Pursue him, ho! Go after. By no means what?
Exeunt some Servants

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Persuade me to the murder of your lordship; But that I told him, the revenging gods 'Gainst parricides did all their thunders bend; Spoke, with how manifold and strong a bond The child was bound to the father; sir, in fine, Seeing how loathly opposite I stood To his unnatural purpose, in fell motion, With his prepared sword, he charges home My unprovided body, lanced mine arm: But when he saw my best alarum'd spirits, Bold in the quarrel's right, roused to the encounter, Or whether gasted by the noise I made, Full suddenly he fled.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Let him fly far: Not in this land shall he remain uncaught; And found--dispatch. The noble duke my master, My worthy arch and patron, comes to-night: By his authority I will proclaim it, That he which finds him shall deserve our thanks, Bringing the murderous coward to the stake; He that conceals him, death.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: When I dissuaded him from his intent, And found him pight to do it, with curst speech I threaten'd to discover him: he replied, 'Thou unpossessing bastard! dost thou think, If I would stand against thee, would the reposal Of any trust, virtue, or worth in thee Make thy words faith'd? No: what I should deny,-- As this I would: ay, though thou didst produce My very character,--I'ld turn it all To thy suggestion, plot, and damned practise: And thou must make a dullard of the world, If they not thought the profits of my death Were very pregnant and potential spurs To make thee seek it.'

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Strong and fasten'd villain Would he deny his letter? I never got him. Hark, the duke's trumpets! I know not why he comes. All ports I'll bar; the villain shall not 'scape; The duke must grant me that: besides, his picture I will send far and near, that all the kingdom May have the due note of him; and of my land, Loyal and natural boy, I'll work the means To make thee capable.
Tucket within
Enter CORNWALL, REGAN, and Attendants

lines.speaker: cornwall
lines.text: How now, my noble friend! since I came hither, Which I can call but now, I have heard strange news.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: If it be true, all vengeance comes too short Which can pursue the offender. How dost, my lord?

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: O, madam, my old heart is crack'd, it's crack'd!

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: What, did my father's godson seek your life? He whom my father named? your Edgar?

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: O, lady, lady, shame would have it hid!

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: Was he not companion with the riotous knights That tend upon my father?

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: I know not, madam: 'tis too bad, too bad.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Yes, madam, he was of that consort.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: No marvel, then, though he were ill affected: 'Tis they have put him on the old man's death, To have the expense and waste of his revenues. I have this present evening from my sister Been well inform'd of them; and with such cautions, That if they come to sojourn at my house, I'll not be there.

lines.speaker: cornwall
lines.text: Nor I, assure thee, Regan. Edmund, I hear that you have shown your father A child-like office.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: 'Twas my duty, sir.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: He did bewray his practise; and received This hurt you see, striving to apprehend him.

lines.speaker: cornwall
lines.text: Is he pursued?

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Ay, my good lord.

lines.speaker: cornwall
lines.text: If he be taken, he shall never more Be fear'd of doing harm: make your own purpose, How in my strength you please. For you, Edmund, Whose virtue and obedience doth this instant So much commend itself, you shall be ours: Natures of such deep trust we shall much need; You we first seize on.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: I shall serve you, sir, Truly, however else.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: For him I thank your grace.

lines.speaker: cornwall
lines.text: You know not why we came to visit you,--

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: Thus out of season, threading dark-eyed night: Occasions, noble Gloucester, of some poise, Wherein we must have use of your advice: Our father he hath writ, so hath our sister, Of differences, which I least thought it fit To answer from our home; the several messengers From hence attend dispatch. Our good old friend, Lay comforts to your bosom; and bestow Your needful counsel to our business, Which craves the instant use.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: I serve you, madam: Your graces are right welcome.
Exeunt
